body: Why is a totally normalized male cliche a normal cliche and then the same impulse in women is a unique villainy that needs a new label?
body_html: Why is a totally normalized male cliche a normal cliche and then the same impulse in women is a unique villainy that needs a new label?
title: why isn't it hypergamy if i get with younger, fitter, smoother women?

author.bio: Just a guy on the internet who's avatar is a giant mutant crocodile. In my spare time I make wooden things, 3D artwork and work on my tabletop RPG, Destructive Tendencies.
author.bio_html: Just a guy on the internet who's avatar is a giant mutant crocodile. In my spare time I make wooden things, 3D artwork and work on my tabletop RPG, Destructive Tendencies.

body:
Hypergamy, by definition, is moving upward to something better. Men don't see getting a younger woman as "moving up to something better" so much as "acquiring something better". It's not the same impulse. Women will ditch a man for a percieved better man, men would happily acquire a younger woman and keep their current woman if they could.

Historically many cultures permitted men to acquire more than one wife/mistress/concubine while women were bound to a single husband, which is why hypergamy is looked down on. As it should be.
body_html:

It's not the same impulse. Women will ditch a man for a percieved better man, men would happily acquire a younger woman and keep their current woman if they could.

Historically many cultures permitted men to acquire more than one wife/mistress/concubine while women were bound to a single husband, which is why hypergamy is looked down on. As it should be.

body: We are a polygynous species. In the vast majority of cultures, one man has multiple women, but women only have one man. Polygynous species are also characterized by more aggressive and violent males (to fight one another for competition), larger males than females, females that mature earlier. I think Indo-European culture is one of the few indigenous cultures to have monogamy.

body:
Yes, but I also explained why. You basically just told me that I'm wrong for saying oranges are not apples because an orange does not meet the textbook definition of an apple.
Women: "If a man of higher status will have me I will ditch my current man" = hypergamy
Men: "If I can land a hot chick but keep my current chick then cool. Ill ditch either one if they are too much trouble" != hypergamy

Can men suffer from hypergamy? Sure, but its rare you find a man who wants to be related to a woman because of her status. Men will take looks over status. Women will take status over looks.
The textbook definition of hypergamy involves status: "Act or practice of seeking a spouse of higher socioeconomic status, or caste status than oneself."

My answer is only retarded if you have low reading comprehension.

body: Of course you haven't seen it "as a property of maleness", because the property you speak of is being filtered out of men and has been for decades. A recent podcast I listened to had one of the hosts telling about his conversation with an old WW2 vet who was describing to him how he'd had one of his girlfriends call another to tell her he'd be late for their date. A perfect example of both dynamics: a high status man making a harem while hypergamous women being perfectly fine with being part of that harem due to the man's status in society. It still happens in colleges, in Hollywood, in sports, in big money. Just because you don't see it doesn't mean it's not going on around you, especially since the West moved away from polygyny a long time ago, much to it's own downfall. Of course you know a bunch of "mated men", a modern age man with more than one wife is an oddity and is treated as such. It happened. It happens today, and it will continue to happen so long as the human race continues.
body_html: Of course you haven't seen it "as a property of maleness", because the property you speak of is being filtered out of men and has been for decades. A recent podcast I listened to had one of the hosts telling about his conversation with an old WW2 vet who was describing to him how he'd had one of his girlfriends call another to tell her he'd be late for their date. A perfect example of both dynamics: a high status man making a harem while hypergamous women being perfectly fine with being part of that harem due to the man's status in society. It still happens in colleges, in Hollywood, in sports, in big money. Just because you don't see it doesn't mean it's not going on around you, especially since the West moved away from polygyny a long time ago, much to it's own downfall. Of course you know a bunch of "mated men", a modern age man with more than one wife is an oddity and is treated as such. It happened. It happens today, and it will continue to happen so long as the human race continues.

parent.body: Of course you haven't seen it "as a property of maleness", because the property you speak of is being filtered out of men and has been for decades. A recent podcast I listened to had one of the hosts telling about his conversation with an old WW2 vet who was describing to him how he'd had one of his girlfriends call another to tell her he'd be late for their date. A perfect example of both dynamics: a high status man making a harem while hypergamous women being perfectly fine with being part of that harem due to the man's status in society. It still happens in colleges, in Hollywood, in sports, in big money. Just because you don't see it doesn't mean it's not going on around you, especially since the West moved away from polygyny a long time ago, much to it's own downfall. Of course you know a bunch of "mated men", a modern age man with more than one wife is an oddity and is treated as such. It happened. It happens today, and it will continue to happen so long as the human race continues.

parent.body: We are a polygynous species. In the vast majority of cultures, one man has multiple women, but women only have one man. Polygynous species are also characterized by more aggressive and violent males (to fight one another for competition), larger males than females, females that mature earlier. I think Indo-European culture is one of the few indigenous cultures to have monogamy.

I think Indo-European culture is one of the few indigenous cultures to have monogamy.

body:
Yes, Indo-Iranians were monogamous. Not sure if you’re joking or misinformed.

> The basic unit of Aryan society was the extended and patriarchal family. A cluster of related families constituted a village, while several villages formed a tribal unit. Child marriage, as practiced in later eras, was uncommon, but the partners' involvement in the selection of a mate and dowry and bride-price were customary. The birth of a son was welcome because he could later tend the herds, bring honor in battle, offer sacrifices to the gods, and inherit property and pass on the family name. Monogamy was widely accepted although polygamy was not unknown, and even polyandry is mentioned in later writings. Ritual suicide of widows was expected at a husband's death, and this might have been the beginning of the practice known as sati in later centuries, when the widow actually burnt herself on her husband's funeral pyre.
body_html:
Yes, Indo-Iranians were monogamous. Not sure if you’re joking or misinformed.

The basic unit of Aryan society was the extended and patriarchal family. A cluster of related families constituted a village, while several villages formed a tribal unit. Child marriage, as practiced in later eras, was uncommon, but the partners' involvement in the selection of a mate and dowry and bride-price were customary. The birth of a son was welcome because he could later tend the herds, bring honor in battle, offer sacrifices to the gods, and inherit property and pass on the family name. Monogamy was widely accepted although polygamy was not unknown, and even polyandry is mentioned in later writings. Ritual suicide of widows was expected at a husband's death, and this might have been the beginning of the practice known as sati in later centuries, when the widow actually burnt herself on her husband's funeral pyre.

body: Had to look up how this worked on Brave. Wow that’s crazy. Makes sense though. As a population, any two people are more likely to share a male ancestor rather than share a female ancestor, and your grandfathers from both sides are more likely to be related to one another (having the same great-great-grandfather on multiple branches of your ancestry) than your grandmothers.
body_html: Had to look up how this worked on Brave. Wow that’s crazy. Makes sense though. As a population, any two people are more likely to share a male ancestor rather than share a female ancestor, and your grandfathers from both sides are more likely to be related to one another (having the same great-great-grandfather on multiple branches of your ancestry) than your grandmothers.

post.body: Why is a totally normalized male cliche a normal cliche and then the same impulse in women is a unique villainy that needs a new label?
post.body_html: Why is a totally normalized male cliche a normal cliche and then the same impulse in women is a unique villainy that needs a new label?
post.title: why isn't it hypergamy if i get with younger, fitter, smoother women?

body:
> Polygynous species are also characterized by more aggressive and violent males (to fight one another for competition), larger males than females, females that mature earlier.

Humans aren't like this as a whole species, though this does seem to be the dominant state. There are also humans that lack these traits and usually have a natural desire of monogamy along with it.
body_html:
Polygynous species are also characterized by more aggressive and violent males (to fight one another for competition), larger males than females, females that mature earlier.

Humans aren't like this as a whole species, though this does seem to be the dominant state. There are also humans that lack these traits and usually have a natural desire of monogamy along with it.

parent.body: We are a polygynous species. In the vast majority of cultures, one man has multiple women, but women only have one man. Polygynous species are also characterized by more aggressive and violent males (to fight one another for competition), larger males than females, females that mature earlier. I think Indo-European culture is one of the few indigenous cultures to have monogamy.
parent.body_html: We are a polygynous species. In the vast majority of cultures, one man has multiple women, but women only have one man. Polygynous species are also characterized by more aggressive and violent males (to fight one another for competition), larger males than females, females that mature earlier. I think Indo-European culture is one of the few indigenous cultures to have monogamy.

body:
The real reason that no one wants to tell you is that males have a primal instinct to pass on their genes and have *biological* children. Therefore they value virginity in a woman because it means they can be sure their children are actually their own genes and blood. Women do not usually, as any child they have is obviously theirs, and may even see virginity in a man as a weakness and a turn-off.

There's also the fact that females are wired to like being dominated and "owned" by males, and males have a desire to control their females.

Basically sex is stupid and it's best to just ignore it.
body_html:
The real reason that no one wants to tell you is that males have a primal instinct to pass on their genes and have biological children. Therefore they value virginity in a woman because it means they can be sure their children are actually their own genes and blood. Women do not usually, as any child they have is obviously theirs, and may even see virginity in a man as a weakness and a turn-off.

There's also the fact that females are wired to like being dominated and "owned" by males, and males have a desire to control their females.

Basically sex is stupid and it's best to just ignore it.

body: Most men will have strong urges to stray over their lifetime. Seems like it’s natural. But then again, you have homosexuality and “transgenderism” and all sorts of various things where the way you’re raised overrides nature in what would usually be a catastrophic way for your prime directive as an organism. So there’ll be a few men who never feel that strong urge.

body: No, monogamy and less dimorphism (especially behavior-wise) is the natural state for certain groups of humans. Others trend toward polygamy and strong dimorphism, especially on the male side. There are different traits adapted to different environments. The latter does seem to dominate the modern world but that doesn't mean others are non-existent.
body_html: No, monogamy and less dimorphism (especially behavior-wise) is the natural state for certain groups of humans. Others trend toward polygamy and strong dimorphism, especially on the male side. There are different traits adapted to different environments. The latter does seem to dominate the modern world but that doesn't mean others are non-existent.
